feels.name: Trust
feels.quote: Rosamond, with her gravest mildness; 'I would not tell mamma for the world.'

feels.name: Surprise
feels.quote: Rosamond blushed deeply and felt a certain astonishment.

feels.name: Joy
feels.quote: Rosamond could not doubt that this was the great epoch of her life.

feels.name: Anticipation
feels.quote: Rosamond, though no older than Mary, was rather used to being fallen in love with; but she, for her part, had remained indifferent and fastidiously critical towards both fresh sprig and faded bachelor.

feels.name: Annoyance
feels.quote: Mary, from some cause, looked rather out of temper.

feels.name: Disapproval
feels.quote: Mary spoke from a girlish impulse which got the better of her judgment.

feels.name: Fear
feels.quote: Fred, who had his own reasons for not being in the best spirits, and wanted to get away.

feels.name: Admiration
feels.quote: He reached the whip before she did, and turned to present it to her. She bowed and looked at him: he of course was looking at her, and their eyes met with that peculiar meeting which is never arrived at by effort, but seems like a sudden divine clearance of haze.

Places.name: Sitting_Room
Places.description: The room where the characters gathered and interacted.

Places.name: On_the_way_home
Places.description: The setting where Rosamond was contemplating her future.
